result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A. Madson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
DOC shall not reflexibely put a no-contact order between the parties before judiciously considering all factors.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance; victim present.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.
Time of FPT changed to 3pm today (in lieu of 9am which was the original time of JS for today)

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Defense moves for an adjournment; needs discovery DVD, 911 tape, etc.  FPT adj to 5/11/15 @ 9am.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John A. Ward. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Det. Eric Traxler sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Ward. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-23-15 @ 10:00am. Note: Atty. Ward will be in trial at this time, but no other dates were available. Atty. Ward to contact judge's clerk if he needs to reschedule. Jury selection on 5-11-15 @ 9:00am. Note: Atty. Ward has a trial already scheduled on 5-11-15 in Br. 8. Bond continued.

115pm
  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John A Ward.   Clerk: KZ.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 3/26/15 @ 830am.  Bond Continued.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Def. has privately retained Atty. John A. Ward, who does not appear. Atty. Kristyne Watson was appointed by SPD's Office and is relieved of further duty. Time limits tolled at request of def. Attorney status on 3-10-15 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
